title: Smart Data Models - PositionPoint
description: Adapted from CIM data models. Set of spatial coordinates that determine a point, defined in the coordinate system specified in 'Location.CoordinateSystem'. Use a single position point instance to desribe a point-oriented location. Use a sequence of position points to describe a line-oriented object (physical location of non-point oriented objects like cables or lines), or area of an object (like a substation or a geographical zone - in this case, have first and last position point with the same values).

type.description: Property. NGSI type. It has to be PositionPoint

Location.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Location described by this position point. Default: None

sequenceNumber.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Zero-relative sequence number of this point within a series of points. Default: 0

xPosition.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. X axis position. Default: ''

yPosition.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Y axis position. Default: ''

zPosition.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. (if applicable) Z axis position. Default: ''
